abstract: Basic goods and services are in short supply in Venezuela, as country lacks currency due to plunging price of oil, its biggest export; government troops patrol long lines of people waiting for supplies, and stand ready to arrest those shoppers cheating rationing system; Venezuela was in deep recession even before oil prices collapsed (Series: By the Barrel).
lead_paragraph: Because Venezuela is so dependent on oil sales to buy imports of food, medicine and many other basics, the drop in oil prices means that there is even less hard currency to buy what the country needs.

byline.contributor: Catalina Lobo-Guerrero and Patricia Torres contributed reporting.

snippet: Because Venezuela is so dependent on oil sales to buy imports of food, medicine and many other basics, the drop in oil prices means that there is even less hard currency to buy what the country needs.

headline.main: Oil Cash Waning, Venezuelan Shelves Lie Bare
headline.print_headline: Oil Cash Waning, Venezuelan Shelves Lie Bare
